name: Hiking
description: Hiking involves walking in natural environments, often on hiking trails. It is a popular outdoor activity which offers the chance to observe nature and often requires a good physical condition.

name: Running
description: Running is a method of terrestrial locomotion allowing humans and other animals to move rapidly on foot. It is a type of gait characterized by an aerial phase in which all feet are above the ground.

name: Walking
description: Walking is one of the most fundamental means of transport. It involves traveling by foot at a moderate pace and can be a leisure activity or a sport.

name: Trail Running
description: Trail running is a sport which consists of running and hiking over trails. It differs from road running and track running in that it generally takes place on hiking trails, often in mountainous terrain.

name: Alpine Climbing
description: Alpine climbing, or mountaineering, involves ascending mountains. Alpine climbing is distinguished by its extended duration and need for versatile skills like navigation, rock climbing, and handling cold weather.

name: Nordic Walking
description: Nordic walking is a total body version of walking that can be done both by non-athletes as a health-promoting physical activity, and by athletes as a sport. The activity is performed with specially designed walking poles similar to ski poles.

name: Orienteering
description: Orienteering is a group of sports that require navigational skills using a map and compass to navigate from point to point in diverse and usually unfamiliar terrain, and normally moving at speed.

name: Plogging
description: Plogging is an eco-friendly exercise which combines jogging with picking up litter. It started as an organized activity in Sweden around 2016 and spread to other countries due to concerns about plastic pollution.

name: Barefoot
description: Barefoot walking or running refers to physical activities performed without shoes, allowing for natural foot movements and a more direct contact with the ground, often thought to provide health benefits.

name: Mountain Bike
description: Mountain biking is a sport of riding bicycles off-road, often over rough terrain, using specially designed mountain bikes. It requires balance, bike handling skills, and endurance.

name: Road Bike
description: Road biking involves cycling on paved roads, typically using road bicycles which are lightweight and designed for speed and distance. It's a popular form of exercise and can be a competitive sport or a leisure activity.

name: Bicycle Touring
description: Bicycle touring is a form of cycling where people travel long distances on their bikes, often carrying gear for self-sustained trips. It's a way to see new places and enjoy the outdoors.

name: Bikepacking
description: Bikepacking combines mountain biking and minimalist camping. It involves riding off-road on mountain bikes, carrying only essential gear, and is about exploration and adventure in the wilderness.

name: eBike
description: eBiking involves riding bicycles equipped with an electric motor that provides assistance, making it easier to cycle, especially uphill. It's suitable for people who want to ride with less effort.

name: Gravel Bike
description: Gravel biking involves riding on a variety of surfaces including gravel and dirt. Gravel bikes are designed to handle diverse terrain, combining elements of road and mountain bikes.

name: Downhill MTB
description: Downhill mountain biking (MTB) is a genre of mountain biking practiced on steep, rough terrain that often features jumps, drops, rock gardens and other obstacles. It's an extreme and adventurous form of mountain biking.

name: Mountain Unicycle
description: Mountain unicycling is an adventure sport that consists of traversing rough terrain on a unicycle. It requires significant skill and balance, and offers a unique challenge compared to traditional bicycling.

name: Trailer Bike
description: A trailer bike allows children to accompany an adult on longer bike rides. It is essentially a child's bicycle with the front wheel, fork, and headset replaced by a long towbar or boom.

name: Handbike
description: Handbiking is a form of cycling with a hand-powered bike. It's a popular sport for people with lower limb mobility restrictions, and is also pursued by able-bodied individuals for exercise and recreation.

name: Kickbike
description: A kickbike is a type of scooter that generally has a larger front wheel than back wheel and a platform for the rider's feet. It is propelled by the rider pushing off the ground with their foot.

name: Via Ferrata
description: Via Ferrata, Italian for 'iron path', combines hiking and climbing. Participants use steel cables, ladders, and other fixed anchors like iron rungs to climb along routes set into natural rock formations.

name: Canyoneering
description: Canyoneering involves exploring canyons through various means such as walking, scrambling, climbing, jumping, abseiling, and swimming. It's an adventurous activity requiring navigation and rope work skills.

name: Rock Climbing
description: Rock climbing is an activity in which participants climb up, down, or across natural rock formations or artificial rock walls. It's a mentally and physically demanding sport that tests a climber's strength, endurance, agility, and balance.

name: Spelunking
description: Spelunking, or caving, is the exploration of caves. It often involves the challenges of navigating through tight passages, climbing or rappelling, and sometimes swimming or wading in cave waters.

name: Ice Climbing
description: Ice climbing involves ascending inclined ice formations. Climbers use ice axes and crampons to climb frozen waterfalls, icefalls, or cliffs and rock slabs covered with ice refrozen from flows of water.

name: Backcountry Ski
description: Backcountry skiing, also known as off-piste skiing, involves skiing in the backcountry on unmarked or unpatrolled areas, either outside ski resort boundaries or in remote areas. It combines skiing with mountaineering and typically requires knowledge of avalanche safety.

name: Snowshoe
description: Snowshoeing is a form of hiking in the snow with snowshoes, which distribute the weight of the person over a larger area so that the person's foot does not sink completely into the snow. It's a popular winter activity for exploration and fitness.

name: Alpine Ski
description: Alpine skiing, or downhill skiing, involves descending a snow-covered hill on skis with fixed-heel bindings. It's a popular winter sport and includes various techniques like turns and jumps.

name: Cross Country Ski
description: Cross country skiing is a form of skiing where skiers rely on their own locomotion to move across snow-covered terrain, rather than using ski lifts or other forms of assistance. It's great for aerobic exercise and enjoying scenic landscapes.

name: Snowboarding
description: Snowboarding involves descending a snow-covered slope while standing on a snowboard attached to a rider's feet. It's a popular winter sport that combines elements of surfing, skateboarding, and skiing.

name: Snowmobile
description: Snowmobiling is riding on a snowmobile, a motorized vehicle designed for winter travel and recreation on snow. It's popular in areas where snow remains for long periods and can range from leisure to competitive racing.

name: Splitboard
description: Splitboarding is a type of snowboarding where the board divides into two separate skis for uphill travel (similar to ski touring). The halves can then be reconnected for downhill riding. It's popular for backcountry snowboarding.

name: Freeride Ski
description: Freeride skiing is a style of skiing performed on natural, un-groomed terrain, without a set course, goals or rules. It emphasizes creativity, fluidity, and exploration, often in challenging terrain.

name: Kite Ski
description: Kite skiing is a snow sport using a kite to pull the rider through the snow on skis. It combines elements of snowboarding, windsurfing, surfing, paragliding, and skateboarding. It's an emerging sport gaining popularity in snowy regions.

name: Sledding
description: Sledding involves sliding down snow-covered hills using a sled. It's a popular winter activity, especially among children, and can range from casual play to formal racing events.

name: Kayak/Canoe
description: Kayaking and canoeing are activities involving paddling a kayak or canoe, both small, narrow watercraft propelled by means of a double-bladed paddle (kayak) or a single-bladed paddle (canoe). These activities are enjoyed in various water settings from calm lakes to white-water rivers.

name: Motorboat
description: Motorboating involves traveling over water in a motorboat, which is a boat powered by an engine. Some motorboats are fitted for leisure, like cruising or fishing, while others are designed for sports or fast speeds.

name: Swimming
description: Swimming is the self-propulsion of a person through water, usually for recreation, sport, exercise, or survival. It's an important life skill and a major competitive sport as well.

name: Sail Boat
description: Sailing involves using sailboats for sporting or recreational purposes. Sailing boats are propelled partly or entirely by sails and are used on seas, lakes, or rivers.

name: Stand up Paddle
description: Stand up paddleboarding (SUP) is an offshoot of surfing that originated in Hawaii. Unlike traditional surfing where the rider sits until a wave comes, stand up paddle boarders stand on their boards and use a paddle to propel themselves through the water.

name: Rowing
description: Rowing is the act of propelling a boat using the motion of oars in the water. It can be done for recreational purposes, as a competitive sport, or as a means of transportation.

name: Jet Ski
description: Jet skiing involves riding a jet ski, which is a small, jet-propelled vehicle that skims across the surface of water and is ridden in a similar way to a motorcycle. It is a popular water sport known for speed and agility.

name: Kitesurfing
description: Kitesurfing, also known as kiteboarding, combines aspects of wakeboarding, windsurfing, surfing, paragliding, and gymnastics into one extreme sport. A kitesurfer harnesses the power of the wind with a large controllable kite to be propelled across the water on a kiteboard.

name: Diving
description: Diving involves submerging underwater using equipment like scuba gear, which includes an independent breathing apparatus. It allows for greater mobility and extended time underwater for recreation, scientific research, or underwater photography.

name: Airboat
description: Airboat riding involves operating a flat-bottomed boat that is propelled by an aircraft-type propeller and is powered by either an aircraft or automotive engine. It's commonly used for fishing, hunting, and ecotourism, especially in shallow, swampy areas.

name: Rafting
description: Rafting is an outdoor activity which uses an inflatable raft to navigate a river or other body of water. This is often done on whitewater or different degrees of rough water, challenging the rafters to work as a team to maneuver the raft.

name: Horseback Riding
description: Horseback riding, or equestrianism, involves the skill of riding, driving, or vaulting with horses. This broad description includes the use of horses for practical working purposes, transportation, recreational activities, artistic or cultural exercises, and competitive sport.

name: Canicross
description: Canicross is the sport of cross country running with dogs. Originating in Europe as off-season training for the mushing (dog sledding) community, it has become popular as a stand-alone sport all over Europe, especially in the UK.

name: Birdwatching
description: Birdwatching is a form of wildlife observation in which the observation of birds is a recreational activity or citizen science. It can be done with the naked eye, through a visual enhancement device like binoculars and telescopes, or by listening for bird sounds.

name: Wildlife Watching
description: Wildlife watching involves observing and studying animals in their natural habitat as a recreational activity. It can include observing birds, mammals, insects, and other wildlife and is often done with the aid of binoculars or cameras.

name: Dog Sledding
description: Dog sledding is a form of transportation or sport where sled dogs, typically in teams, pull a sled on snow. It's a popular activity in regions with snow cover and is also pursued competitively in dog sled races.

name: Camel
description: Camel riding involves riding camels, either as a means of transportation or for recreational purposes. It's often associated with travel in desert regions and offers a unique way to explore such landscapes.

name: Skating
description: Skating generally refers to moving on ice by using ice skates. It can be done for leisure, travel, or various sports including speed skating, figure skating, ice hockey, and touring.

name: Inline Skate
description: Inline skating is a multi-disciplinary sport and can refer to a number of activities practiced using Inline skates. Inline skates typically have 2 to 5 polyurethane wheels, arranged in a single line by a metal or plastic frame on the underside of a boot.

name: Segway
description: Riding a Segway involves using a two-wheeled, self-balancing personal transporter. It's often used for leisurely tours or short-distance travel in urban settings and is known for its ease of use and maneuverability.

name: Longboard/Skateboard
description: Longboarding and skateboarding are sports that involve riding and performing tricks using a longboard or skateboard. Longboarding is often faster due to larger wheels and is used for cruising, downhill racing, slalom racing, sliding, dancing, and transport.

name: Scooter
description: Riding a scooter involves a two-wheeled vehicle with a step-through frame and a platform for the rider's feet. It can refer to both motor scooters and push scooters, used for both transportation and recreation.

name: Roller Ski
description: Roller skiing is an off-season, cross-training activity that mimics cross-country skiing. It's done on roller skis, which are wheeled ski-like apparatuses. It provides a snow-free training method for skiers.

name: Baby Stroller
description: Pushing a baby stroller involves walking or jogging while pushing a baby stroller. It is a way for parents to maintain fitness and share outdoor experiences with their infants or toddlers.

name: Handbike
description: Handbiking, similar to earlier listed, is a form of cycling with a hand-powered bike. It's a popular sport for people with lower limb mobility restrictions, and is also pursued by able-bodied individuals for exercise and recreation.

name: Reduced Mobility
description: Activities for those with reduced mobility often include adaptive methods or equipment, allowing individuals to enjoy a range of sports and recreational activities, regardless of physical limitations.

name: Blind People
description: This category includes various activities adapted for blind or visually impaired individuals. These activities are modified to ensure safety and accessibility, allowing blind individuals to participate fully.

name: Joëlette
description: A Joëlette is a one-wheeled all-terrain chair maneuvered by two or more people, designed for individuals with reduced mobility. It allows them to participate in hiking or running on trails not accessible with regular wheelchairs.

name: Car
description: Car driving as a recreational activity can include road trips, touring, racing, and off-roading. It offers a way to explore distant places, enjoy the thrill of driving, and participate in automotive sports.

name: Off Road
description: Off-roading is driving on unsurfaced roads or tracks, made of materials such as sand, gravel, riverbeds, mud, snow, rocks, and other natural terrain. It often involves modified vehicles specifically designed to overcome difficult terrains.

name: Road Motorbike
description: Road motorbiking involves riding motorcycles on paved roads. It can range from short rides to long-distance touring and can include high-speed racing. Road motorbikes are designed for speed, agility, and long-distance comfort.

name: Dual-sport Motorcycle
description: Dual-sport motorcycling involves motorcycles that are designed to be ridden off-road as well as on pavement. These bikes are often well-suited for both dirt and asphalt, making them versatile for different terrains.

name: Quad
description: Riding a quad, or ATV (All-Terrain Vehicle), involves a vehicle that travels on low-pressure tires, with a seat straddled by the operator, and handlebars for steering control. Quads are used for recreation and in some industries.

name: Enduro Motorcycle
description: Enduro motorcycling is a form of motorcycle sport run on extended cross-country, off-road courses. Enduro consists of many different obstacles and challenges and is timed, with riders expected to maintain a strict schedule.

name: Motorhome
description: Traveling in a motorhome involves using a type of self-propelled recreational vehicle (RV) which offers living accommodation combined with a vehicle engine. It's popular for road trips and nomadic lifestyles, allowing travelers to bring the comforts of home with them.

name: Motorcycle Trials
description: Motorcycle trials is a non-speed event on specialized motorcycles. The sport is about riding through an obstacle course without setting foot on the ground. It requires immense skill and balance to control the bike while navigating the course.

name: Plane
description: Flying a plane involves operating an aircraft, and it ranges from small private planes to larger commercial flights. Aviation can be a hobby, a sport, or a profession and offers a unique perspective of the world from above.

name: Paragliding
description: Paragliding is a recreational and competitive flying sport. A paraglider is a free-flying, foot-launched aircraft. The pilot sits in a harness suspended below a fabric wing, resembling a parachute, to catch thermals and soar through the sky.

name: Hot Air Balloon
description: Hot air ballooning is the activity of flying hot air balloons. It offers a serene and gentle flying experience, often used for recreational and sightseeing purposes. The balloon is propelled by wind and the pilot controls altitude by managing the hot air.

name: Hang Gliding
description: Hang gliding is an air sport in which a pilot flies a light and non-motorized foot-launchable aircraft called a hang glider. This activity is known for its ability to achieve sustained flight with unpowered gliders.

name: Drone
description: Flying a drone involves operating a small unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) for recreational or professional purposes. Drones are used for photography, videography, racing, and just for the fun of flying.

name: BASE Jumping
description: BASE jumping is a form of skydiving. Instead of jumping from a plane, BASE jumpers leap from fixed objects like buildings, antennae, spans (bridges), and earth (cliffs) using a parachute to break their fall.

name: Flora Observation
description: Flora observation involves studying or admiring plant life in its natural environment. This can be a leisure activity or a more serious field of study, often involving hiking or walking in nature.

name: Train
description: Traveling by train can be both a mode of transportation and a leisure activity. It offers a chance to see landscapes and explore different areas, sometimes with historic or scenic train routes.

name: Multisport
description: Multisport refers to athletic contests that involve participating in more than one sport, such as triathlons, which include swimming, cycling, and running. It's a test of endurance and versatility.

name: Golf
description: Golf is a sport in which players use various clubs to hit balls into a series of holes on a course in as few strokes as possible. It is one of the few ball games that do not require a standardized playing area.
